verses.roman:
śasya khāya kukkura, 'kṛṣṇa' kahe bāra bāra
dekhiyā lokera mane haila camatkāra

synonyms: śasya khāya—eats the pulp of green coconut; kukkura—the dog; kṛṣṇa—the holy name of Kṛṣṇa; kahe—chants; bāra bāra—again and again; dekhiyā—seeing this; lokera—of all the people; mane—in the minds; haila—there was; camatkāra—astonishment.
translation: Seeing the dog eating the green coconut pulp and chanting "Kṛṣṇa, Kṛṣṇa" again and again, all the devotees present were very much surprised.
